test-set.name: array-fold-right
test-set.description: Tests for the array:fold-right function introduced in XPath 3.1

test-case.name: array-fold-right-001
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with integer members

test-case.name: array-fold-right-002
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with array members

test-case.name: array-fold-right-003
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with string members

test-case.name: array-fold-right-004
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with string members

test-case.name: array-fold-right-005
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with function members

test-case.name: array-fold-right-006
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with string members
test-case.test: array:fold-right([" opened the door", " went up stairs"], "Bob", function($a,$z){concat($z, $a)})

all-of.assert-deep-eq: "Bob went up stairs opened the door"

test-case.name: array-fold-right-007
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with boolean members (example from spec)
test-case.test: array:fold-right([true(), true(), false()], true(), function($x, $y){$x and $y})

test-case.name: array-fold-right-008
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with boolean members (example from spec)
test-case.test: array:fold-right([true(), true(), false()], false(), function($x, $y){$x or $y})

test-case.name: array-fold-right-009
test-case.description: Apply fold-right function to array with array members (example from spec)
